maven2-moduleset.description:
Build Nabla Bower sample nightly at midnight.
The main goals of this job is to do clean build fast, every day and provide quick feedback to developer.
It keeps build history for trend analyses.

Report as much as possible (like the equivalent continuous job):
  • tests results
  • coding style
  • formatter
  • pmd
  • cpd
  • checkstyle
  • findbugs
  • javadoc
  • cobertura/clover/jacoco
  • pitest
  • sonar
as soon it does not take too long.

For jacoco to work.
do not use org.jacoco:jacoco-maven-plugin:prepare-agent but mvn verify -Psample,run-its,jacoco -Djacoco.outputDir=${WORKSPACE}/target

For pitest to work.
mvn install org.pitest:pitest-maven:mutationCoverage

For integration test to work.
mvn install -Prun-its mvn install -Dlog4j.configuration=log4j.properties -Dlog4j.debug=true -Prun-its,arq-weld-ee-embedded

info.scriptContent: cd $WORKSPACE echo "git.revision=$(git rev-parse --short HEAD)" echo "git.branch=$(git log -n 1 --pretty=%d HEAD | sed 's/.*origin\///;s/[),].*//')"

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash #set -xv
git clean -fdx git --no-pager log --max-count=10 --graph --abbrev-commit
echo $'\u2192'
git --version || true svn --version || true echo USER: ${USER} #bower cache clean #npm cache clean #export PATH=$PATH:$ZAPROXY_HOME #export NODE_PATH=$NODE_PATH:$WORKSPACE/lib/node_modules echo NODE_PATH: ${NODE_PATH} echo PATH: ${PATH} node --version || true npm --version || true
echo DISPLAY $DISPLAY
export ZAP_PORT=8095 export JETTY_PORT=9090 export SERVER_HOST=localhost
echo "ZAP_PORT : $ZAP_PORT" echo "CARGO_RMI_PORT : $CARGO_RMI_PORT" echo "JETTY_PORT : $JETTY_PORT" echo "SERVER_HOST : $SERVER_HOST" echo "ZAPROXY_HOME : $ZAPROXY_HOME"
#rm ./zap.sh || true #ln -s ${ZAPROXY_HOME}/zap.sh zap.sh
#browser version #/usr/bin/firefox -V #/usr/lib/firefox/firefox -V firefox -V || true #/usr/bin/chromium-browser --version #/opt/google/chrome/chrome --version chrome --version || true
export PHANTOMJS_BIN=`which phantomjs`
#npm install --global phantomjs phantomjs --version || true
lsof -i :$CARGO_RMI_PORT || true
# If Server is still running we will get its PID #PORT_WHERE_SERVER_MIGHT_RUN=$ZAP_PORT PORT_WHERE_SERVER_MIGHT_RUN=8443
PID=$(lsof -t -i:$PORT_WHERE_SERVER_MIGHT_RUN) || true
# -z is zero length (unset or empty string" # if NOT zero length => then kill it... if [ ! -z "$PID" ]; then echo "Found running Server at port: "$PORT_WHERE_SERVER_MIGHT_RUN" (PID: "$PID")" #echo "I am killing that Server. A previous build seems to have gone wrong." # Kill it... hooray! #kill $PID
else echo "No running Server found at port "$PORT_WHERE_SERVER_MIGHT_RUN". This is what I'd anticipate. Great!" fi
#./zap.sh -port $ZAP_PORT -daemon
echo SONAR_BRANCH=$(printf '%s' $GIT_BRANCH | cut -d'/' -f 2- | sed s/[^0-9a-zA-Z:_.\-]/'_'/g) > sonar-branch

#!/bin/bash #set -xv node --version || true #./node/node --version #npm --version npm --version || true #./clean.sh bower --version || true #./bower list nsp --version || true nsp check || true
#./npm install codecov.io --save
export CODECOV_TOKEN="23ccf822-ee60-4d0f-8332-9c692389b2e2"
#istanbul cover jasmine-node --captureExceptions spec/ \ # && cat ./coverage/coverage.json | ./node_modules/codecov.io/bin/codecov.io.js
#rm ./target/test.png || true phantomjs --version || true #./phantomjs --proxy=127.0.0.1:8090 --debug=true --web-security=false --ignore-ssl-errors=true --cookies-file=./target/cookies.txt rasterize.js http://localhost:$JETTY_PORT/ ./target/test.png || true #./phantomjs --debug=true --web-security=false --ignore-ssl-errors=true --cookies-file=./target/cookies.txt netsniff.js http://localhost:$JETTY_PORT/ > ./target/speed.har || true
GCVIEWER_VERSION="1.35-SNAPSHOT" #See https://github.com/chewiebug/GCViewer #wget http://kgrweb/download/gcviewer/gcviewer-${GCVIEWER_VERSION}.jar java -jar /workspace/divers/GCViewer/target/gcviewer-${GCVIEWER_VERSION}.jar gc.log export target/gc.png
TAG=LATEST_SUCCESSFULL cd $WORKSPACE/ DOESTAGEXISTCMD="git tag -l | grep $TAG" eval $DOESTAGEXISTCMD if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then git tag -d $TAG git push origin :$TAG fi git tag -a $TAG -m "Jenkins develop" git push origin $TAG --force
#git fetch --prune origin +refs/tags/*:refs/tags/ git fetch --tags
#git show $TAG
GIT_LATEST_SUCCESSFUL_COMMIT=$(git rev-parse --short $TAG) echo "GIT_LATEST_SUCCESSFUL_COMMIT= ${GIT_LATEST_SUCCESSFUL_COMMIT}"
#make version file cd ${WORKSPACE}/ FILENAME=$JOB_NAME"_VERSION.TXT" echo "$JOB_NAME: BUILD: $BUILD_NUMBER SHA1:${GIT_LATEST_SUCCESSFUL_COMMIT}" > ${WORKSPACE}/$FILENAME
